Package game

Class ChaosGame

java.lang.Object
game.ChaosGame
public class ChaosGame extends Object
The chaos game.
The game consists of nodes and dots. Nodes refer to the objects that can be fixed in advance on the playing area. Their number remains unchanged. The dots are generated continuously during the game and follow the nodes.
Author:
Mika Thein
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ChaosGame

      public ChaosGame(Node[] nodes, int startX, int startY, float divisor)
      Initialises a new game.
      Parameters:
      nodes - A list of the nodes. May not be empty or null. Each node has to own an unique name within this array.
      startX - The x position of the first dot.
      startY - The y position of the first dot.
      divisor - The divisor by which the distance from the last dot to a random node is divided.
      See Also:
      • play()
      • nodes
      • dots
      • divisor
      • ChaosGame

    • getNodeOccurrence

      public int getNodeOccurrence(String name)
      Parameters:
      name - The name of a node.
      Returns:
      How often a node has been selected as a target node.
